The object has a height of approximately 0.17 units. **Sketch 1:** 1. Draw a circle. Set the center at (0.375, 0.329) and use a radius of 0.125 units. This circle defines the central cylindrical core of the object. 2. Create a rectangular shape around the circle, with vertices at (0.3542, 0.3081), (0.3958, 0.3081), (0.3958, 0.3498), and (0.3542, 0.3498). 3. Extrude the sketch by 0.1667 units towards the positive normal direction to create the cylindrical core. **Sketch 2:** 1. Draw four arcs connecting the midpoints of the sides of the previously drawn rectangle. Use the midpoints (0.375, 0.3081), (0.375, 0.3498), (0.5625, 0.3785), and (0.5625, 0.2815) as the starting points for each arc. Use (0.5, 0.329) as the endpoint for all arcs to ensure symmetry and continuity. 2. Connect the endpoints of the arcs to form a closed shape, resulting in a petal-like form around the central cylindrical core. 3. Extrude the sketch by 0.1667 units in the direction of the positive normal direction to create the four arms around the core. Upon completion of the sketches and extrusions, the resulting shape should match the description provided in the JSON, resulting in a symmetrical metallic object with a central cylindrical core and four protruding arms arranged in a circular pattern around the core. The final shape has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 units (radius of the circular pattern) - Width: 0.75 units (radius of the circular pattern) - Height: 0.1667 units (height of the extrusions)</description>
